intro: Morina polyphylla, commonly known as the many-leaved moringa, is a shrub native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds, which are often used in traditional medicine. Morina polyphylla thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showing adaptability to poor soil conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
